message.content:
```json
{
    "ocr_text": "Mr. Frank Duffy--------3--------

as sailors,” is misleading. The object of that artificer class

is, as stated above, to take the poor workmen from civil life who

will enlist, and make a better workman of him for the purposes of
the Navy afloat. The instruction given in no way interferes with
civilian employees on the repair work of ships at Navy Yards, as the
members of the class are not utilized for this work. Moreover the
number in the class is strictly limited to the needs of the Fleet.
The millions spent yearly upon repairs to ships at Navy Yards go

to civilian employees, and there is no intention on the part of the

Department to utilize classes under instruction upon such work.

Undoubtedly this statement of the aims and practice of
the artificer class will convince the President of the American
i

Federation of Labor that no injustice is being done, to the Ameri-


can civilian workman, and that he will appreciate the stand the Ameri-

can United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners has taken for

the safety of the American fleet imperatively demanding that on board

an instruction of such craftsmen as will improve the technial
are incompetent to perform the duties which will devolve upon them

Respectfully,

(signed) G. Von Meyor,

----
-----Secretary of the Navy.

I wish you would give the Secretary’s letter further

consideration and advise me further in regard thereto, It

seems to me that the matter should be called to the attention of
Brother Huber, President of your organization, and you may determine

that it should also receive the attention of your Executive Board.
In any event, let me hear from you in regard to the matter at your
earliest convenience.

With best wishes, I am

Fraternally yours,
(signed)
American Federation of Labor.",
    "summary": "The letter clarifies that the training provided in the artificer class is for enhancing the skills of enlisted men specifically for the Navy and does not interfere with civilian work or employment in navy yards. It ensures that there is no intention to utilise these trained men for tasks meant for civilian employees. The writer asks for further consideration of the issue and suggests bringing it to the attention of the Executive Board for further action.",
    "date": "2023-10-01", // placeholder date as actual date is not available
    "is_printed": true,
    "is_legible": true
}
```
